reason: Expresses feelings of being lost, overwhelmed, and struggling to continue. While not explicitly suicidal, the statement 'Hard to keep going' indicates potential despair and requires attention.

title: User Story: Self-Harm
content: I messed up. Relapsed after 6 months clean. Feeling so ashamed and lost. Reaching out for support. Please, any advice?
reason: Relapse after a period of sobriety combined with feelings of shame and loss can increase the risk of impulsive behavior and mental health decline.

title: User Story: Self-Harm
content:
**Option 1 (Seeking Help):**

> "Relapsed after a few months clean. Feeling so ashamed and alone. Reaching out for support. Anyone else been there?"

**Option 2 (Personal Story/Awareness):**

> "Scars aren't for attention, they're a reminder of battles fought. Healing is possible. Be kind to those struggling. You're not alone."

**Option 3 (Venting/Reaching Out):**

> "The urges are so strong tonight. Just trying to get through it. Anything helps. Distractions? Kind words?"
reason: While none of the options explicitly mention intent to self-harm or suicide, Option 1 describes a relapse, increasing vulnerability. Option 3 expresses strong urges, indicating an acute struggle and elevated risk, though seeking help is a positive sign. Option 2 is supportive but does not directly indicate crisis, and could be posted by someone not currently in danger. The presence of relapse and strong urges elevates the overall risk level.

title: User Story: Overdose
content: Seeing a friend OD was terrifying. Narcan saved their life. Carry it if you can, learn how to use it. It could save someone you love. Seriously.
reason: The text describes a life-threatening overdose situation. While Narcan was used to save the individual, the inherent risk of overdose is extremely high.
